CatDescriptText: Leon Lowe, concessionaire, 7227 Kelly Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the increasing demand for father and mother to work, thus taking both parents out of the home for the better part of the day, affects their children as regards discipline, ambition, and social compatibility in general?" answer reads: "It depends on the age of the children and the neighborhood in which the family is living.  If the children are going to school the parents can work if there is one of the youngsters who will be home to take care of the otheres when they come in from school."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Leon Lowe wearing light colored fedora, eyeglasses, and textured coat, standing with hands in pockets, on Liberty Avenue in front of Raab Clothes, Downtown
